snippet: An overwhelming majority voted on Sunday to leave Ukraine in a referendum that Western leaders have declared illegal and vowed to punish with sanctions.
abstract: Overwhelming majority of Crimeans vote to secede from Ukraine and join Russia, resolutely carrying out referendum that Western leaders have declared is illegal and vow to punish with economic sanctions; outcome deepens conflict over Ukraine, forcing United States and European allies to decide how swiftly and forcefully to act on sanctions.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by C.J. Chivers from Kharkiv, Ukraine; Andrew E. Kramer from Kiev, Ukraine; Noah Sneider from Bakhchysaray, Ukraine; Patrick Reevell from Sevastopol, Ukraine; Peter Baker and Michael R. Gordon from Washington; and Steven Lee Myers from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: An overwhelming majority voted on Sunday to leave Ukraine in a referendum that Western leaders have declared illegal and vowed to punish with sanctions.

headline.main: Crimea Votes to Secede From Ukraine as Russian Troops Keep Watch
headline.print_headline: Crimea Votes to Secede From Ukraine as Russian Troops Keep Watch
